the: surrendering the charge to the liquidator for the general benefit of creditors.

Reiterating: The words relinquish, surrender or waive, according to Garner's Dictionary of Legal Usage

the: (Third Edition, 2011)  share the sense "to give up something." Relinquish means precisely
that, or sometimes more specifically "to let something out of one's control, possession, or

the current statutoty: intentionally  relinquish  a  known  right,  not  by  force  or

the: necessarily but by choice. The  word implies  a refusal  to  insist  on the continuation  of  a
right, claim, immunity or on the continued observance of a rule.
The Random House Dictionary of the  English  Language (the Unabridged Version) defines
surrender to mean yielcling something to the possession or power of another.
